title: Function Pointers
subject: C Programming
theory:
Storing address of a function. 
Allows passing functions as arguments (Callbacks). 
Simulates Polymorphism.

examples.code: void qsort(base, n, size, int (*compare)(const void*, const void*));

common_mistakes.correction: `int *f()` is function returning int pointer. `int (*f)()` is pointer to function returning int.
